explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of machine learning (ML) in combination with artificial intelligence (AI) to improve the identification and diagnosis of Lumpy Skin Disease (LSD) in cattle.
explanations.classification: The study involves classifying skin conditions in cattle, specifically identifying Lumpy Skin Disease (LSD), using a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN).
explanations.neural network: The paper mentions the use of neural networks, specifically Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), for disease detection in cattle.
explanations.deep learning: The study employs deep learning techniques, as CNNs are a type of deep learning model, to analyze images and detect diseases in cattle.
explanations.convolutional neural network: The paper highlights the use of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for the identification of Lumpy Skin Disease Virus (LSDV) in animals, demonstrating their application in veterinary medicine.
explanations.CNN: The study specifically uses a CNN-based model to classify skin conditions in cattle, achieving an accuracy of 73.89% after training.
